reviews.review_msg: Pretty boring, so bring coffee. Didn't need the textbook at all. The slides are summaries of the readings from the textbook. Knows his stuff. The TA I had sucked and marked difficulty. The final was wretched. I'd suggest reading the novels since you have to write a short essay for it in the midterm and the final.

Michael is honestly a really good prof. His lectures were clear and informative. He clearly is passionate about history which was seen a lot throughout our class, but he was understanding if you werent that well versed. I honestly didnt try a lot in this class, but an A is more than doable if you participate in tutorials and keep up with readings

Michael really knows his stuff and you can tell he's passionate about the subject. He gets interesting and useful discussions going during lectures. Attend tutorials since you'll discuss the readings and novels that you'll be tested on in the midterm and final. Don't get the textbook. Same content is summarized profusely on the slides.

The final exam for the course was kind of a killer, but the midterm and the long paper before that were super-easy, so it's all good. Professor Lanthier made the course really interesting and fun even though we covered a LOT of material in a short period of time.
Dr. Lanthier is very passionate about what he teaches, which makes the long lectures bearable. Workload is quite light, and tutorials are engaging. Overall, an excellent professor.
